title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 4-9.5 - Burner flame failure controls
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 4-9.5 - Burner flame failure controls

State Regulations
(a) Input rating under 400,000 Btu. For burners with an input rating less than
400,000 Btu per hour, the main gas valve shall close automatically within 90
seconds after flame failure. (b) Input rating of 400,000 Btu plus. For burners with an input rating of 400,000

Btu per hour or more, the electrical circuit to the main fuel valve shall be
automatically de-energized within four seconds after flame failure and the
de-energized valve shall automatically close within the next five
seconds. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
4-9.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
